content: Administrative entry restrictions **Visa requirements for Singapore citizens** are administrative entry restrictions by the authorities of other states which are imposed on citizens of Singapore. As of 2026, holders of [Singapore passports](/wiki/Singapore_passport) have visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to a total of 193 countries and territories, ranking the Singapore passport 1st in the world according to [Henley Passport Index](/wiki/Henley_Passport_Index). ## Changes Visa requirements for Singapore citizens were recently lifted by [Tajikistan](/wiki/Tajikistan) (1 January 2022), [Guyana](/wiki/Guyana) (1 October 2023), [Iran](/wiki/Iran) (4 February 2024) and [Timor-Leste](/wiki/East_Timor) (3 July 2024). Timeline (expansion of visa privileges) - No historical visa requirements: Brunei *(visa-free)*; Indonesia *(visa-free)*; Ireland *(visa-free)*; Schengen Area (European Union + Iceland, Liechtenstein, Monaco, Norway, San Marino, Switzerland, and Vatican City; applies to Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, and Romania; excludes Ireland) *(visa-free)*; United Kingdom *(visa-free)* - 1972: Japan *(visa-free; 1 January)* - 1982: South Korea *(visa-free; 1 November)* - 1985: France *(visa-free, 1 June)* - 1987: New Zealand *(visa-free; 1 November)* - 1990: Mongolia *(visa-free; 9 March)* - 1996: Australia *(electronic authorisation; 11 September)* - 1999: Argentina *(visa-free; 5 August)*; United States *(electronic authorisation; 9 August)* - 2001: Taiwan *(visa-free; 1 May)* - 2003: China *(visa-free; 1 July)*; Slovakia *(visa-free; 13 August)*; Vietnam *(visa-free; 1 December)* - 2014: Brazil *(visa-free; 9 January)*; India *(e-Visa; November)* - 2015: Kazakhstan *(visa-free; 15 July)* - 2016: Suriname *(visa-free; January)*; Azerbaijan *(visa on arrival; February)*; Cuba *(visa-free; May)*; Myanmar *(visa-free; 1 December)* - 2017: Belarus *(visa-free; 12 February)*; Primorye, Khabarovsk, Sakhalin, Chukotka, and Kamchatka regions of the Russian Far East *(visa on arrival; August)*; Qatar *(visa-free, 9 August)*; Paraguay *(visa-free; 5 October)* - 2018: Djibouti *(visa-free; 21 January)*; Uzbekistan *(visa-free; 10 February)*; Armenia *(visa-free; 21 March)*; Angola *(visa-free; 30 March)*; Guinea *(visa-free; 20 November)* - 2019: Saudi Arabia *(e-Visa/visa on arrival; September)* - 2022: Tajikistan *(visa-free; 1 January)* - 2023: Guyana *(visa free; 1 October)* - 2024: Iran *(visa free; 4 February)*; Timor-Leste *(visa-free; 3 July)* ## Visa requirements map ## Visa requirements Visa requirements for holders of normal passports travelling for tourist purposes: Country / RegionVisa requirementAllowed stayNotes (excluding departure fees)Reciprocity [Afghanistan](/wiki/Afghanistan)Visa required - The Government of Singapore advises its citizens not to travel to Afghanistan due to the [ongoing situation in the country](/wiki/Afghan_conflict). √ [Albania](/wiki/Albania)Visa not required90 days - May enter Albania using a [national ID card](/wiki/National_Registration_Identity_Card) in lieu of a passport. √ [Algeria](/wiki/Algeria)Visa required√ [Andorra](/wiki/Andorra)Visa not required90 days√ [Angola](/wiki/Angola)Visa not required30 days - For a maximum total stay of 90 days within any 1-year period. √ [Antigua and Barbuda](/wiki/Antigua_and_Barbuda)Visa not required6 months√ [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina)Visa not required90 days√ [Armenia](/wiki/Armenia)Visa not required180 daysX [Australia](/wiki/Australia)[Electronic Travel Authority](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Australia#Electronic_visas)90 days - 90 days on each visit in a 12-month period if granted. - May enter using [SmartGate](/wiki/SmartGate) on arrival in Australia. - Also eligible for a visitor visa (subclass 600) with a validity of six years, allowing a maximum stay of three months per entry during the visa's validity period. X [Austria](/wiki/Austria)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Azerbaijan](/wiki/Azerbaijan)eVisa / Visa on arrival30 days - Available at airports. - Singaporeans of Armenian origin will be permanently banned from entering Azerbaijan and will be included into the "list of [persona non grata](/wiki/Persona_non_grata)". X [Bahamas](/wiki/The_Bahamas)Visa not required3 months√ [Bahrain](/wiki/Bahrain)eVisa / Visa on arrival14 daysX [Bangladesh](/wiki/Bangladesh)Visa on arrival30 days - Not available at all entry points. X [Barbados](/wiki/Barbados)Visa not required6 months√ [Belarus](/wiki/Belarus)Visa not required / eVisa30 days - Must arrive and depart via [Minsk International Airport](/wiki/Minsk_International_Airport). X [Belgium](/wiki/Belgium)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Belize](/wiki/Belize)Visa not required180 days√ [Benin](/wiki/Benin)Visa not required14 days - Must have an international vaccination certificate. √ [Bhutan](/wiki/Bhutan)eVisaX [Bolivia](/wiki/Bolivia)Online Visa / Visa on arrival30 daysX [Bosnia and Herzegovina](/wiki/Bosnia_and_Herzegovina)Visa not required90 days√ [Botswana](/wiki/Botswana)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 1-year period. √ [Brazil](/wiki/Brazil)Visa not required30 days√ [Brunei](/wiki/Brunei)Visa not required30 days√ [Bulgaria](/wiki/Bulgaria)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Burkina Faso](/wiki/Burkina_Faso)Visa not required30 days√ [Burundi](/wiki/Burundi)Online Visa / Visa on arrival1 month - From December 2021, passengers of all countries that require a visa, can now obtain a visa on arrival at [Bujumbura International Airport](/wiki/Bujumbura_International_Airport), and all land borders. X [Cambodia](/wiki/Cambodia)Visa not required30 days√ [Cameroon](/wiki/Cameroon)eVisa - Holders of a pre-arranged approval issued by "Le Delegue General de la Surete" can obtain a visa on arrival. X [Canada](/wiki/Canada)Electronic Travel Authority6 months - [eTA](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Canada#Electronic_travel_authorization) required if arriving by air; not required if arriving by land or sea. √ [Cape Verde](/wiki/Cape_Verde)Visa not required90 days√ [Central African Republic](/wiki/Central_African_Republic)Visa requiredX [Chad](/wiki/Chad)Visa not required90 days√ [Chile](/wiki/Chile)Visa not required30 days√ [China](/wiki/China)Visa not required30 days - A 30-day mutual visa waiver agreement was signed with China and was effective on 9 February 2024. √ [Colombia](/wiki/Colombia)Visa not required90 days - 90 days - extendable up to 180-day stay within a 1-year period. √ [Comoros](/wiki/Comoros)Visa on arrival45 daysX [Republic of the Congo](/wiki/Republic_of_the_Congo)Visa required - Except passengers with a VIP invitation. X [Democratic Republic of the Congo](/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo)eVisa7 daysX [Costa Rica](/wiki/Costa_Rica)Visa not required90 days√ [Côte d'Ivoire](/wiki/Ivory_Coast)Visa not required90 days√ [Croatia](/wiki/Croatia)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180 day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Cuba](/wiki/Cuba)Visa not required30 days√ [Cyprus](/wiki/Cyprus)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period. √ [Czech Republic](/wiki/Czech_Republic)Visa not required3 months - 3 months, regardless of previous time spent in other Schengen Area countries (pursuant to the Czech Republic-Singapore bilateral agreement that was concluded before the Czech Republic joined the European Union and the Schengen Area). √ [Denmark](/wiki/Denmark)Visa not required3 months - 3 months within the past 6 months, regardless of previous time spent in other [Schengen countries](/wiki/Schengen_Area), but including time spent in other Nordic countries. √ [Djibouti](/wiki/Djibouti)Visa not required√ [Dominica](/wiki/Dominica)Visa not required6 months√ [Dominican Republic](/wiki/Dominican_Republic)Visa not required30 days√ [Ecuador](/wiki/Ecuador)Visa not required90 days√ [Egypt](/wiki/Egypt)eVisa / Visa on arrival30 days - 15 day free visa on arrival if arriving and departing from Sharm El-Sheikh, St Catherine and Taba Airports X [El Salvador](/wiki/El_Salvador)Visa not required3 months√ [Equatorial Guinea](/wiki/Equatorial_Guinea)eVisaX [Eritrea](/wiki/Eritrea)Visa requiredX [Estonia](/wiki/Estonia)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Eswatini](/wiki/Eswatini)Visa not required30 days√ [Ethiopia](/wiki/Ethiopia)eVisa / Visa on arrivalup to 90 days - e-Visa holders must arrive via [Addis Ababa Bole International Airport](/wiki/Addis_Ababa_Bole_International_Airport). X [Fiji](/wiki/Fiji)Visa not required4 months√ [Finland](/wiki/Finland)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [France](/wiki/France)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area) (in [Regions of France](/wiki/Regions_of_France)). √ [Gabon](/wiki/Gabon)Visa not required30 days√ [Gambia](/wiki/The_Gambia)Visa not required90 days√ [Georgia](/wiki/Georgia_(country))Visa not required1 yearX [Germany](/wiki/Germany)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Ghana](/wiki/Ghana)Visa not required60 days√ [Greece](/wiki/Greece)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Grenada](/wiki/Grenada)Visa not required3 months√ [Guatemala](/wiki/Guatemala)Visa not required90 days√ [Guinea](/wiki/Guinea)Visa not required30 days√ [Guinea-Bissau](/wiki/Guinea-Bissau)Visa on arrival90 daysX [Guyana](/wiki/Guyana)Visa not required30 days√ [Haiti](/wiki/Haiti)Visa not required3 months√ [Honduras](/wiki/Honduras)Visa not required3 months√ [Hungary](/wiki/Hungary)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Iceland](/wiki/Iceland)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [India](/wiki/India)eVisa30 days - e-Visa holders must arrive via 32 designated airports[Note 1] or 5 designated seaports.[Note 2] - An Indian e-Tourist Visa may only be obtained twice within 1 calendar year. - Foreigners of Pakistani origin or who hold a Pakistani Passport are not eligible for an e-Visa. Foreigners who are not Pakistani nationals, but whose parents or grandparents (either paternal or maternal) were born in, or were permanent residents in Pakistan, are also not eligible for an e-Visa. - Holders of a valid [Person of Indian Origin](/wiki/Person_of_Indian_Origin) or [Overseas Citizen of India](/wiki/Overseas_Citizen_of_India) Card are exempt from visa requirements, and may travel to India unlimited times. √ [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia)Visa not required30 days√ [Iran](/wiki/Iran)Visa not required15 days - 15 days within any 6-month period. - The Government of Singapore advises its citizens not to travel to Iran due to security issues in the country. X [Iraq](/wiki/Iraq)eVisa30 days - The Government of Singapore advises its citizens not to travel to Iraq due to the [security situation in the country](/wiki/Iraqi_conflict). X [Ireland](/wiki/Republic_of_Ireland)Visa not required3 months√ [Israel](/wiki/Israel)Electronic Travel Authorization90 days√ [Italy](/wiki/Italy)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Jamaica](/wiki/Jamaica)Visa not required6 months√ [Japan](/wiki/Japan)Visa not required90 days√ [Jordan](/wiki/Jordan)eVisa / Visa on arrival - A 40 JOD Visa can be obtained upon arrival, but the fee can be waived for single entry evisa or visa on arrival if purchase Jordan Pass, obtainable at most international ports of entry and land border crossings (except [King Hussein/Allenby Bridge](/wiki/Allenby_Bridge)). X [Kazakhstan](/wiki/Kazakhstan)Visa not required30 daysX [Kenya](/wiki/Kenya)Visa not required90 days√ [Kiribati](/wiki/Kiribati)Visa not required90 days√ [North Korea](/wiki/North_Korea)Visa required√ [South Korea](/wiki/South_Korea)Visa not required90 days - Singapore citizens can enter South Korea up to 90 days without a visa. - A K-ETA application can be completed up to 24 hours before boarding a flight. It will be valid for 3 years. - Singapore citizens are exempt from the K-ETA requirement from 1 April 2023 until 31 December 2025. √ [Kosovo](/wiki/Kosovo)Visa not required90 daysX [Kuwait](/wiki/Kuwait)eVisa / Visa on arrival3 months - e-Visa is also available online. X [Kyrgyzstan](/wiki/Kyrgyzstan)Visa not required60 daysX [Laos](/wiki/Laos)Visa not required30 days√ [Latvia](/wiki/Latvia)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). - From 1 September 2025, citizens of Singapore intending to enter Latvia without a visa or residence permit are required to submit an electronic declaration form at least 48 hours before seeking entry into Latvia. √ [Lebanon](/wiki/Lebanon)Free Visa on arrival1 month - 1 month extendable for 2 additional months. - Granted free of charge at [Beirut International Airport](/wiki/Beirut_International_Airport) or any other port of entry if there is no Israeli visa or stamp in the passport, and in possession of a phone number & address to be visited in Lebanon, and a non-refundable onward or round trip ticket. - The Government of Singapore advises its citizens not to travel to Lebanon due to the [volatile situation in the country](/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Hezbollah_conflict_(2023%E2%80%93present)). X [Lesotho](/wiki/Lesotho)Visa not required30 days√ [Liberia](/wiki/Liberia)e-VOAX [Libya](/wiki/Libya)eVisa - The Government of Singapore advises its citizens not to travel to Libya due to civil unrest, and the [political instability in the country](/wiki/Libyan_crisis_(2011%E2%80%93present)). X [Liechtenstein](/wiki/Liechtenstein)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Lithuania](/wiki/Lithuania)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Luxembourg](/wiki/Luxembourg)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Madagascar](/wiki/Madagascar)Online Visa / Visa on arrival60 daysX [Malawi](/wiki/Malawi)Visa not required30 daysX [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia)Visa not required1 month√ [Maldives](/wiki/Maldives)Free visa on arrival30 daysX [Mali](/wiki/Mali)Visa required√ [Malta](/wiki/Malta)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Marshall Islands](/wiki/Marshall_Islands)Visa on arrival90 daysX [Mauritania](/wiki/Mauritania)eVisa30 daysX [Mauritius](/wiki/Mauritius)Visa not required90 days√ [Mexico](/wiki/Mexico)Visa not required180 days√ [Micronesia](/wiki/Federated_States_of_Micronesia)Visa not required30 days√ [Moldova](/wiki/Moldova)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period. X [Monaco](/wiki/Monaco)Visa not required90 days√ [Mongolia](/wiki/Mongolia)Visa not required30 days√ [Montenegro](/wiki/Montenegro)Visa not required90 days√ [Morocco](/wiki/Morocco)Visa not required90 daysX [Mozambique](/wiki/Mozambique)Visa not required30 days - Singaporeans do not need a visa to enter Mozambique for 30 days if they pay a tax fee of 650 MT, provided that they present normal passports valid for 6 months on arrival, as well as a return or onward ticket and a hotel reservation confirmation. In addition, an extension of 30 days is possible. √ [Myanmar](/wiki/Myanmar)Visa not required30 days - The Government of Singapore advises its citizens not to travel to Myanmar due to [the security situation in the country](/wiki/Myanmar_civil_war_(2021%E2%80%93present)). Singaporeans are advised to leave as soon as possible. √ [Namibia](/wiki/Namibia)Visa not required90 days√ [Nauru](/wiki/Nauru)Visa requiredX [Nepal](/wiki/Nepal)Online Visa / Visa on arrival90 daysX [Netherlands](/wiki/Netherlands)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area) ([European Netherlands](/wiki/European_Netherlands)). √ [New Zealand](/wiki/New_Zealand)[Electronic Travel Authority](/wiki/New_Zealand_Electronic_Travel_Authority)3 months - May enter using [eGate](/wiki/SmartGate). - [International Visitor Conservation and Tourism Levy](/wiki/International_Visitor_Conservation_and_Tourism_Levy) must be paid upon requesting an Electronic Travel Authority. - Holders of an Australian Permanent Resident Visa or Resident Return Visa may be granted a New Zealand Resident Visa on arrival permitting indefinite stay (pursuant to the [Trans-Tasman Travel Arrangement](/wiki/Trans-Tasman_Travel_Arrangement)), subject to meeting character requirements and obtaining an Electronic Travel Authority prior to departure. Such travellers are not required to pay the International Visitor Conservation and Tourism Levy. X [Nicaragua](/wiki/Nicaragua)Visa not required90 days√ [Niger](/wiki/Niger)Visa requiredX [Nigeria](/wiki/Nigeria)eVisa30 days - Holders of written e-visa approval issued by Immigration Authority Headquarters in Abuja, can obtain a visa on arrival. √ [North Macedonia](/wiki/North_Macedonia)Visa not required90 days√ [Norway](/wiki/Norway)Visa not required3 months - 3 months within the past 6 months, regardless of previous time spent in other [Schengen countries](/wiki/Schengen_Area), but including time spent in other Nordic countries √ [Oman](/wiki/Oman)Visa not required / eVisa14 days / 30 days√ [Pakistan](/wiki/Pakistan)Free eVisa90 days - Pakistan e-Visa fee is free. - Electronic Travel Authorization to obtain a visa on arrival for business and tourism purposes. X [Palau](/wiki/Palau)Free visa on arrival30 days - A visa is issued free of charge upon arrival at any port of entry. X [Panama](/wiki/Panama)Visa not required90 days√ [Papua New Guinea](/wiki/Papua_New_Guinea)eVisa / Visa on Arrival60 daysX [Paraguay](/wiki/Paraguay)Visa not required30 days√ [Peru](/wiki/Peru)Visa not required90 days√ [Philippines](/wiki/Philippines)Visa not required30 days - A single or multiple entry eVisa for stays of up to 59 days is also available. √ [Poland](/wiki/Poland)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within a 180-day period, regardless of previous time spent in other [Schengen countries](/wiki/Schengen_Area) (pursuant to the Poland-Singapore bilateral agreement regulating visa-free traffic that was concluded before Poland joined the European Union and the Schengen Area). √ [Portugal](/wiki/Portugal)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Qatar](/wiki/Qatar)Visa not required30 days√ [Romania](/wiki/Romania)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Russia](/wiki/Russia)eVisa30 days - Holders of an APEC Business Travel Card (ABTC) travelling on business do not require a visa. √ [Rwanda](/wiki/Rwanda)Visa not required90 days√ [Saint Kitts and Nevis](/wiki/Saint_Kitts_and_Nevis)[Electronic Travel Authorisation](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Saint_Kitts_and_Nevis)3 months√ [Saint Lucia](/wiki/Saint_Lucia)Visa not required15 days√ [Saint Vincent and the Grenadines](/wiki/Saint_Vincent_and_the_Grenadines)Visa not required3 month√ [Samoa](/wiki/Samoa)Entry permit on arrival90 days√ [San Marino](/wiki/San_Marino)Visa not required90 days√ [São Tomé and Príncipe](/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Tom%C3%A9_and_Pr%C3%ADncipe)eVisa - Travelers holding a visa issued by the United States or a Schengen Member State together with a passport valid for a minimum of 3 months from the arrival date may enter visa-free for a stay of up to 15 days X [Saudi Arabia](/wiki/Saudi_Arabia)eVisa / Visa on arrival90 daysX [Senegal](/wiki/Senegal)Visa not required90 days√ [Serbia](/wiki/Serbia)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within 6-month period. √ [Seychelles](/wiki/Seychelles)Electronic Border System3 months - Application can be submitted up to 30 days before travel. - Visitors must upload a reservation confirmation(s) for each visitor's location of stay in Seychelles. - Yellow fever vaccination certificate is required if coming from endemic countries. - Payment of the fee (EUR 10) by credit or debit card. - Valid for one journey only and it expires once exit the country. X [Sierra Leone](/wiki/Sierra_Leone)Free visa on arrival30 daysX [Slovakia](/wiki/Slovakia)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Slovenia](/wiki/Slovenia)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Solomon Islands](/wiki/Solomon_Islands)Free Visitor's permit on arrival3 months - 3 months within any 1-year period. X [Somalia](/wiki/Somalia)eVisa30 daysX [South Africa](/wiki/South_Africa)Visa not required90 days√ [South Sudan](/wiki/South_Sudan)eVisa - Obtainable online. - Printed visa authorization must be presented at the time of travel. X [Spain](/wiki/Spain)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Sri Lanka](/wiki/Sri_Lanka)Visa not required30 days - Citizens of Singapore are exempt from the requirement of obtaining a tourist standard e-Visa. √ [Sudan](/wiki/Sudan)Visa required - Pre-Approved Visa can be obtained on arrival. √ [Suriname](/wiki/Suriname)Visa not required90 days - An entrance fee of [USD](/wiki/USD) 50 or EUR 50 must be paid online prior to arrival. - Multiple entry e-Visa is also available. √ [Sweden](/wiki/Sweden)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Switzerland](/wiki/Switzerland)Visa not required90 days - 90 days within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area). √ [Syria](/wiki/Syria)eVisa / Visa on arrival - Singaporeans of Syrian origin, or Singaporeans whose passport states that they were born in Algeria, Bahrain, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Mauritania, Morocco, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates or Yemen are visa exempt. X [Tajikistan](/wiki/Tajikistan)Visa not required / eVisa30 days / 60 daysX [Tanzania](/wiki/Tanzania)Visa not required90 days√ [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand)Visa not required60 days√ [Timor-Leste](/wiki/Timor-Leste)Visa not required30 days√ [Togo](/wiki/Togo)eVisa15 daysX [Tonga](/wiki/Tonga)Free visa on arrival31 daysX [Trinidad and Tobago](/wiki/Trinidad_and_Tobago)Visa not required√ [Tunisia](/wiki/Tunisia)Visa not required3 monthsX [Turkey](/wiki/Turkey)Visa not required3 months√ [Turkmenistan](/wiki/Turkmenistan)Visa required√ [Tuvalu](/wiki/Tuvalu)Visa on arrival1 monthX [Uganda](/wiki/Uganda)Visa not required3 months√ [Ukraine](/wiki/Ukraine)eVisa30 days - The Government of Singapore has advised its citizens not to travel to Ukraine due to [Russia's continued aggression towards Ukraine](/wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine). Singaporeans in Ukraine are advised to leave as soon as possible. √ [United Arab Emirates](/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates)Visa not required90 days - Visa on Arrival is issued free of charge for stays not exceeding 90 Days. - Extension is possible for a fee. √ [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom)Electronic Travel Authorisation6 months - [ETA UK](/wiki/Electronic_Travel_Authorisation_(United_Kingdom)) (valid for 2 years when issued) required. - Adults can use ePassport gates. √ [United States](/wiki/United_States)[Visa Waiver Program](/wiki/Visa_Waiver_Program)90 days - [ESTA](/wiki/Electronic_System_for_Travel_Authorization) is valid for 2 years from the date of issuance. - ESTA is also required when entering the country by cruise ship or land. - A [Form I-94](/wiki/Form_I-94) is required for entry into the United States by land. It carries a $30 fee and can be obtained either online or upon arrival. - Visa required for nationals of VWP countries who have travelled or been present in Iran, Iraq, Libya, North Korea, Somalia, Sudan, Syria or Yemen at any time on or after 1 March 2011 (with limited exceptions), or those who have travelled or being present in Cuba at any time on or after 12 January 2021, or nationals of VWP countries who are also nationals of Iran, Iraq, North Korea, Sudan or Syria. √ [Uruguay](/wiki/Uruguay)Visa not required3 months√ [Uzbekistan](/wiki/Uzbekistan)Visa not required30 daysX [Vanuatu](/wiki/Vanuatu)Visa not required120 days√ [Vatican City](/wiki/Vatican_City)Visa not required90 days√ [Venezuela](/wiki/Venezuela)Visa requiredX [Vietnam](/wiki/Vietnam)Visa not required30 days√ [Yemen](/wiki/Yemen)Visa required - The Government of Singapore has advised its citizens not to travel to Yemen due to [the ongoing civil war in the country](/wiki/Yemeni_civil_war_(2014%E2%80%93present)). Singaporeans currently in Yemen are advised to leave immediately. √ [Zambia](/wiki/Zambia)Visa not required90 days√ [Zimbabwe](/wiki/Zimbabwe)Visa not required3 months√ ### Territories and disputed areas Visa requirements for Singapore citizens for visits to various territories, disputed areas, partially recognised countries and restricted zones: Visitor toVisa requirementNotes (excluding departure fees)Europe [Abkhazia](/wiki/Abkhazia)Visa required [Mount Athos](/wiki/Mount_Athos)Special permit requiredSpecial permit required (4 days: [EUR](/wiki/EUR) 25 for [Orthodox](/wiki/Eastern_Orthodox_Church) visitors, EUR 35 for non-Orthodox visitors, EUR 18 for students). There is a visitors' quota: maximum 100 [Orthodox](/wiki/Eastern_Orthodox_Church) and 10 non-Orthodox per day and women are not allowed. [Brest](/wiki/Brest,_Belarus) and [Grodno](/wiki/Grodno)Visa not requiredVisa-free for 10 days [Northern Cyprus](/wiki/Northern_Cyprus)Visa not required3 months [UN Buffer Zone in Cyprus](/wiki/United_Nations_Buffer_Zone_in_Cyprus)Access Permit requiredAccess Permit is required for travelling inside the zone, except Civil Use Areas. [Faroe Islands](/wiki/Faroe_Islands)Visa not required [Gibraltar](/wiki/Gibraltar)Visa not required [Guernsey](/wiki/Guernsey)Visa not required [Isle of Man](/wiki/Isle_of_Man)Visa not required [Jan Mayen](/wiki/Jan_Mayen)Permit requiredPermit issued by the local police required for staying for less than 24 hours and permit issued by the [Norwegian police](/wiki/Norwegian_Police_Service) for staying for more than 24 hours. [Jersey](/wiki/Jersey)Visa not required [Russia](/wiki/Russia)Special authorization requiredSeveral [closed cities and regions in Russia](/wiki/Russian_closed_city) require special authorization. [South Ossetia](/wiki/South_Ossetia)Visa requiredTo enter South Ossetia, visitors must have a multiple-entry visa for [Russia](/wiki/Russia) and register their stay with the Migration Service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs within 3 days. [Transnistria](/wiki/Transnistria)Visa not requiredRegistration required after 24 hours.Africa [British Indian Ocean Territory](/wiki/British_Indian_Ocean_Territory)Special permit requiredSpecial permit required. [Eritrea](/wiki/Eritrea) outside [Asmara](/wiki/Asmara)Travel permit requiredTo travel in the rest of the country, a Travel Permit for Foreigners is required (20 [Eritrean nakfa](/wiki/Eritrean_nakfa)). [Mayotte](/wiki/Mayotte)Visa not required [Réunion](/wiki/R%C3%A9union)Visa not required [Ascension Island](/wiki/Ascension_Island)eVisa - 3 months within any 1-year period. [Saint Helena](/wiki/Saint_Helena)Visitor's Pass requiredVisitor's Pass granted on arrival valid for 4/10/21/60/90 days for 12/14/16/20/25 [pound sterling](/wiki/Pound_sterling). [Tristan da Cunha](/wiki/Tristan_da_Cunha)Permission requiredPermission to land required for 15/30 [pounds sterling](/wiki/Pound_sterling) (yacht/ship passenger) for Tristan da Cunha Island or 20 [pounds sterling](/wiki/Pound_sterling) for [Gough Island](/wiki/Gough_Island), [Inaccessible Island](/wiki/Inaccessible_Island) or [Nightingale Islands](/wiki/Nightingale_Islands). [Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic](/wiki/Sahrawi_Arab_Democratic_Republic)Undefined visa regimeUndefined visa regime in the [Western Sahara controlled territory](/wiki/Free_Zone_(region)). [Somaliland](/wiki/Somaliland)Visa required [Sudan](/wiki/Sudan)Travel permit requiredAll foreigners travelling more than 25 kilometres (16 mi) outside of [Khartoum](/wiki/Khartoum) must obtain a travel permit. [Darfur](/wiki/Darfur)Travel permit requiredSeparate travel permit is required.Asia [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong)Visa not required90 days [India](/wiki/India) PAP/RAPPAP/RAP requiredProtected Area Permit (PAP) required for whole states of [Nagaland](/wiki/Nagaland) and [Sikkim](/wiki/Sikkim) and parts of states [Manipur](/wiki/Manipur), Arunachal Pradesh, [Uttaranchal](/wiki/Uttaranchal), Jammu and Kashmir, [Rajasthan](/wiki/Rajasthan), Himachal Pradesh. Restricted Area Permit (RAP) is required for all of [Andaman and Nicobar Islands](/wiki/Andaman_and_Nicobar_Islands) and parts of [Sikkim](/wiki/Sikkim). Some of these requirements are occasionally lifted for a year. [Kazakhstan](/wiki/Kazakhstan)Special permission requiredSpecial permission required for the town of [Baikonur](/wiki/Baikonur) and surrounding areas in [Kyzylorda Oblast](/wiki/Kyzylorda_Oblast), and the town of [Gvardeyskiy](/wiki/Gvardeyskiy,_Kazakhstan) near [Almaty](/wiki/Almaty). [Kish Island](/wiki/Kish_Island)Visa not requiredVisitors to [Kish Island](/wiki/Kish_Island) do not require a visa. [Macao](/wiki/Macau)Visa not required30 days [Sabah](/wiki/Sabah) and [Sarawak](/wiki/Sarawak)Visa not requiredThese states have their own immigration authorities and a passport is required to travel to them, however, the same visa applies. [Maldives](/wiki/Maldives)Permission requiredWith the exception of the capital [Malé](/wiki/Mal%C3%A9), tourists are generally prohibited from visiting non-resort islands without the express permission of the Government of Maldives. [North Korea](/wiki/North_Korea) outside [Pyongyang](/wiki/Pyongyang)Special permit requiredPeople are not allowed to leave the capital city, tourists can only leave the capital with a governmental tourist guide (no independent moving) [Palestine](/wiki/Palestine)Visa not requiredArrival by sea to [Gaza Strip](/wiki/Gaza_Strip) not allowed. [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan)Visa not required30 days [Gorno-Badakhshan Autonomous Province](/wiki/Gorno-Badakhshan_Autonomous_Province)OIVR permit requiredOIVR permit required (15+5 [Tajikistani Somoni](/wiki/Tajikistani_Somoni)) and another special permit (free of charge) is required for [Lake Sarez](/wiki/Lake_Sarez). [Tibet Autonomous Region](/wiki/Tibet_Autonomous_Region)TTP requiredTibet Travel Permit required (10 US Dollars). [Turkmenistan](/wiki/Turkmenistan)Special permit requiredA special permit, issued prior to arrival by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, is required if visiting the following places: [Atamurat](/wiki/Atamurat), [Cheleken](/wiki/Cheleken), [Dashoguz](/wiki/Dashoguz), [Serakhs](/wiki/Serakhs) and [Serhetabat](/wiki/Serhetabat). [Korean Demilitarized Zone](/wiki/Korean_Demilitarized_Zone)Restricted zoneAn official company is able to provide access to the Buffer Zone. [UNDOF Zone](/wiki/UNDOF_Zone) and [Ghajar](/wiki/Ghajar)Restricted zone [Yemen](/wiki/Yemen)Special permission requiredSpecial permission needed for travel outside [Sana’a](/wiki/Sana%E2%80%99a) or [Aden](/wiki/Aden).Caribbean and North Atlantic [Anguilla](/wiki/Anguilla)Visa not required3 months [Aruba](/wiki/Aruba)Visa not required30 days, extendible to 180 days [Bermuda](/wiki/Bermuda)Visa not requiredUp to 6 months, decided on arrival [Bonaire](/wiki/Bonaire), [St. Eustatius](/wiki/St._Eustatius) and [Saba](/wiki/Saba_(island))Visa not required3 months [British Virgin Islands](/wiki/British_Virgin_Islands)Visa not required30 days, extensions possible [San Andrés](/wiki/San_Andr%C3%A9s_Island) and [Leticia](/wiki/Leticia,_Amazonas)Tourist Card on arrivalVisitors arriving at [Gustavo Rojas Pinilla International Airport](/wiki/Gustavo_Rojas_Pinilla_International_Airport) and [Alfredo Vásquez Cobo International Airport](/wiki/Alfredo_V%C3%A1squez_Cobo_International_Airport) must buy tourist cards on arrival. [Cayman Islands](/wiki/Cayman_Islands)Visa not required6 months [Curacao](/wiki/Cura%C3%A7ao)Visa not required3 months [French Guiana](/wiki/French_Guiana)Visa not required [French West Indies](/wiki/French_West_Indies)Visa not requiredFrench West Indies refers to [Martinique](/wiki/Martinique), Guadeloupe, [Saint Martin](/wiki/Collectivity_of_Saint_Martin) and [Saint Barthélemy](/wiki/Saint_Barth%C3%A9lemy). [Greenland](/wiki/Greenland)Visa not required [Margarita Island](/wiki/Margarita_Island)Visa requiredAll visitors are fingerprinted. [Montserrat](/wiki/Montserrat)Visa not required6 months [Puerto Rico](/wiki/Puerto_Rico)Electronic Authorization [Saint Pierre and Miquelon](/wiki/Saint_Pierre_and_Miquelon)Visa not required [Sint Maarten](/wiki/Sint_Maarten)Visa not required3 months [Turks and Caicos Islands](/wiki/Turks_and_Caicos_Islands)Visa not required90 days [U.S. Virgin Islands](/wiki/United_States_Virgin_Islands)Electronic AuthorizationOceania [American Samoa](/wiki/American_Samoa)Electronic authorization30 days [Ashmore and Cartier Islands](/wiki/Ashmore_and_Cartier_Islands)Special authorisation requiredSpecial authorisation required. [Clipperton Island](/wiki/Clipperton_Island)Special permit requiredSpecial permit required. [Cook Islands](/wiki/Cook_Islands)Visa not required31 days [Lau Province](/wiki/Lau_Province)Special permission requiredSpecial permission required. [French Polynesia](/wiki/French_Polynesia)Visa not required [Guam](/wiki/Guam)Visa not required45 days [New Caledonia](/wiki/New_Caledonia)Visa not required [Niue](/wiki/Niue)Visa not required30 days [Northern Mariana Islands](/wiki/Northern_Mariana_Islands)Visa not required45 days [Pitcairn Islands](/wiki/Pitcairn_Islands)Visa not required14 days visa-free and landing fee 35 [USD](/wiki/USD) or tax of 5 USD if not going ashore. [United States Minor Outlying Islands](/wiki/United_States_Minor_Outlying_Islands)Special permits requiredSpecial permits required for [Baker Island](/wiki/Baker_Island), [Howland Island](/wiki/Howland_Island), [Jarvis Island](/wiki/Jarvis_Island), [Johnston Atoll](/wiki/Johnston_Atoll), [Kingman Reef](/wiki/Kingman_Reef), [Midway Atoll](/wiki/Midway_Atoll), [Palmyra Atoll](/wiki/Palmyra_Atoll) and [Wake Island](/wiki/Wake_Island). [Wallis and Futuna](/wiki/Wallis_and_Futuna)Visa not requiredSouth Atlantic and Antarctica [Falkland Islands](/wiki/Falkland_Islands)Visa not required30 days [South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands](/wiki/South_Georgia_and_the_South_Sandwich_Islands)Permit requiredPre-arrival permit from the Commissioner required (72 hours/1 month for 110/160 [pounds sterling](/wiki/Pound_sterling)). [Antarctica](/wiki/Antarctica)Special permits requiredSpecial permits required for [British Antarctic Territory](/wiki/British_Antarctic_Territory), [French Southern and Antarctic Lands](/wiki/French_Southern_and_Antarctic_Lands), [Argentine Antarctica](/wiki/Argentine_Antarctica), [Australian Antarctic Territory](/wiki/Australian_Antarctic_Territory), [Chilean Antarctic Territory](/wiki/Chilean_Antarctic_Territory), [Heard Island and McDonald Islands](/wiki/Heard_Island_and_McDonald_Islands), [Peter I Island](/wiki/Peter_I_Island), [Queen Maud Land](/wiki/Queen_Maud_Land), [Ross Dependency](/wiki/Ross_Dependency). - Visas for [Cambodia](/wiki/Cambodia), [Myanmar](/wiki/Myanmar), [Rwanda](/wiki/Rwanda), [São Tomé and Príncipe](/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Tom%C3%A9_and_Pr%C3%ADncipe), [Senegal](/wiki/Senegal), [Sri Lanka](/wiki/Sri_Lanka) and [Turkey](/wiki/Turkey) are obtainable online. ## Pre-approved visa pick-up Pre-approved visas can be picked up on arrival in the following countries instead of an embassy or consulate. Pre-approved visas pick-up on arrivalConditions [Bhutan](/wiki/Bhutan)For a maximum stay of 15 days if the application was submitted at least 2+1⁄2 months before arrival and if the clearance was obtained. [Cameroon](/wiki/Cameroon)Must hold approval from the General Delegate of Security. [Eritrea](/wiki/Eritrea)Must have a sponsor who must submit an application at least 48 hours before arrival. [Liberia](/wiki/Liberia)Available only if arriving from a country without a diplomatic mission of Liberia and if a sponsor obtained an approval. [Nigeria](/wiki/Nigeria)Holders of a visa application who have a Nigerian company taking responsibility for them. [Sudan](/wiki/Sudan)Holders of an entry permit issued by the Ministry of Interior. [Turkmenistan](/wiki/Turkmenistan)Holders of an invitation letter of the local company that was approved by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. ## APEC Business Travel Card Holders of an [APEC Business Travel Card (ABTC)](/wiki/APEC_Business_Travel_Card) travelling on business do not require a visa to the following countries: - [Australia](/wiki/Australia)2 - [Brunei](/wiki/Brunei)2 - [Chile](/wiki/Chile)2 - [China](/wiki/China)4 - [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong)4 - [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia)4 - [Japan](/wiki/Japan)2 - [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia)2 - [Mexico](/wiki/Mexico)1 - [New Zealand](/wiki/New_Zealand)2 - [Papua New Guinea](/wiki/Papua_New_Guinea)4 - [Peru](/wiki/Peru)2 - [Philippines](/wiki/Philippines)4 - [Russia](/wiki/Russia)3 - [South Korea](/wiki/South_Korea)2 - [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan)2 - [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand)2 - [Vietnam](/wiki/Vietnam)4 1 - Up to 180 days 2 - Up to 90 days 3 - Up to 90 days in a period of 180 days 4 - Up to 60 days The card must be used in conjunction with a passport and has the following advantages: - No need to apply for a visa or entry permit to [APEC](/wiki/APEC) countries, as the card is treated as such (except by [Canada](/wiki/Canada) and [United States](/wiki/United_States)) - Undertake legitimate business in participating economies - Expedited border crossing in all member economies, including transitional members ## Automated border control systems Singapore citizens aged 6 and older are eligible to use the automated clearance lanes at the ICA Checkpoints run by the [Immigration and Checkpoints Authority](/wiki/Immigration_and_Checkpoints_Authority), provided that their biometric identifiers (iris / facial / fingerprints) have been enrolled with ICA. In addition, for young Singapore citizens who wish to use the automated lanes but had collected their passports before turning six, they may enrol their biometrics at the staffed immigration counters (with the supervision of their parent/guardian). In addition, Singapore citizens who intend to travel as [tourists](/wiki/Tourism), are eligible to use the automated border control systems (eGates) when arriving in (or departing from) the following countries: Country / RegionType of entryDuration of Allowed initial stayName of Immigration AuthorityName of ABC SystemRef [Australia](/wiki/Australia)[Electronic Travel Authority](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Australia#Electronic_visas)90 days[Australian Border Force](/wiki/Australian_Border_Force) (ABF)[SmartGate](/wiki/SmartGate) [Czech Republic](/wiki/Czech_Republic)Visa not required90 days[Ministry of the Interior (Czech Republic)](/wiki/Ministry_of_the_Interior_(Czech_Republic))EasyGo Gate [France](/wiki/France)Visa not required90 days (within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area))[Direction centrale de la police aux frontières](/wiki/Direction_centrale_de_la_police_aux_fronti%C3%A8res) (DCPAF)[PARAFE](/wiki/PARAFE) *[Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong)**Visa not required90 days[Immigration Department (Hong Kong)](/wiki/Immigration_Department_(Hong_Kong))[e-Channel](/wiki/E-Channel) [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia)Visa not required30 days[Directorate General of Immigration](/wiki/Directorate_General_of_Immigration)Autogate [Italy](/wiki/Italy)Visa not required90 days (within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area))[Polizia di Frontiera](/wiki/Polizia_di_Stato#Immigration_and_Border_Police)[EGate (Italy)](/wiki/EGate_(Italy)) *[Japan](/wiki/Japan)**Visa not required90 days[Immigration Services Agency](/wiki/Ministry_of_Justice_(Japan))Automated Gates [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia)Visa not required30 days[Jabatan Imigresen Malaysia](/wiki/Immigration_Department_of_Malaysia)Autogate and MACS 2.0 [Netherlands](/wiki/Netherlands)2Visa not required90 days[Immigratie en Naturalisatiedienst (IND)](/wiki/Immigration_and_Naturalisation_Service_(Netherlands))Self-service passport control (eGates) [New Zealand](/wiki/New_Zealand)[Electronic Travel Authority](/wiki/New_Zealand_Electronic_Travel_Authority)3 months[New Zealand Customs Service](/wiki/New_Zealand_Customs_Service)[eGate](/wiki/SmartGate) [Portugal](/wiki/Portugal)Visa not required90 days (within any 180-day period in the [Schengen Area](/wiki/Schengen_Area))[Serviço de Estrangeiros e Fronteiras](/wiki/Foreigners_and_Borders_Service) (SEF)[RAPID4ALL](/wiki/Automated_border_control_system#Portugal) [South Korea](/wiki/South_Korea)1 2Visa not required3 months[Korea Immigration Service](/wiki/Ministry_of_Justice_(South_Korea))SmartPass [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan)1Visa not required30 days[National Immigration Agency](/wiki/National_Immigration_Agency)e-Gate [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand)Visa not required30 days[Royal Thai Police Immigration Bureau](/wiki/Royal_Thai_Police#Immigration_Bureau)Automated Passport Control (APC) [United Arab Emirates](/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates)1Visa not required30 daysFederal Authority for Identity, Citizenship, Customs and Port Security (FAICCPS)Smart Gate [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom)Visa not required6 months[UK Border Force](/wiki/Border_Force)[EPassport gates](/wiki/EPassport_gates) [United States](/wiki/United_States)1[Visa Waiver Program](/wiki/Visa_Waiver_Program)90 days[U.S. Customs and Border Protection](/wiki/U.S._Customs_and_Border_Protection) (CBP)Mobile Passport Control (MPC) and [Global Entry](/wiki/Global_Entry) * - Automated system enrollment eligibility is limited only to certain categories of travellers. 1 - First-time visitors are required to enrol on their first visit and can only use the automated gates on their subsequent visits. 2 - Use of the E-Gates is only valid when departing from the country and when the traveller is aged 16 & above. ## Non-visa restrictions Many countries have entry restrictions on foreigners that go beyond the common requirement of having either a valid [visa](/wiki/Travel_visa) or a visa exemption. Such restrictions may be health related or impose additional documentation requirements on certain classes of people for diplomatic or political purposes. ### Blank passport pages Many countries require a minimum number of blank pages to be available in the passport being presented, typically one or two pages. Endorsement pages, which often appear after the visa pages, are not counted as being valid or available. ### Vaccination The African countries of [Angola](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Angola), [Benin](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Benin), [Burkina Faso](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Burkina_Faso), [Burundi](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Burundi), [Cameroon](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Cameroon), [Central African Republic](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Central_African_Republic), [Chad](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Chad), [Democratic Republic of the Congo](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_the_Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo), [Republic of the Congo](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_the_Republic_of_the_Congo), [Côte d'Ivoire](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Cote_d%27Ivoire), [Equatorial Guinea](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Equatorial_Guinea), [Gabon](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Gabon), [Gambia](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Gambia), [Ghana](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Ghana), [Guinea-Bissau](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Guinea-Bissau), [Kenya](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Kenya), [Liberia](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Liberia), [Mali](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Mali), [Mauritania](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Mauritania), [Niger](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Niger), [Rwanda](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Rwanda), [Senegal](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Senegal), [Sierra Leone](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Sierra_Leone) and [Togo](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Togo), [South Sudan](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_South_Sudan), [Uganda](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Uganda), and [Zambia](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Zambia), require *all* incoming passengers older than nine months to one year to have a current [International Certificate of Vaccination or Prophylaxis](/wiki/International_Certificate_of_Vaccination_or_Prophylaxis), as does the South American territory of [French Guiana](/wiki/Visa_policies_of_Overseas_France). Some other countries require vaccination only if the passenger is coming from an infected area or has visited one recently or has transited for 12 hours in those countries: Algeria, Botswana, Cabo Verde, Chad, Djibouti, Egypt, Eswatini, Ethiopia, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Lesotho, Libya, Equatorial Guinea, Eritrea, [Madagascar](/wiki/Madagascar), Malawi, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mozambique, Namibia, Nigeria, Papua New Guinea, Seychelles, Somalia, South Africa, Sudan, Tunisia, Uganda, United Republic of Tanzania, Zambia and Zimbabwe. ### Passport validity length Very few countries, such as Paraguay, just require a valid passport on arrival. However many countries and groupings now require only an identity card – especially from their neighbours. Other countries may have special bilateral arrangements that depart from the generality of their passport validity length policies to shorten the period of passport validity required for each other's citizens or even accept passports that have already expired (but *not* been cancelled). Some countries, such as Japan, Ireland and the United Kingdom, require a passport valid throughout the period of the intended stay. In the absence of specific bilateral agreements, countries requiring passports to be valid for at least 6 more months on arrival include Afghanistan, Algeria, Anguilla, Bahrain, Bhutan, Botswana, [British Virgin Islands](/wiki/British_Virgin_Islands), Brunei, Cambodia, Cameroon, Cape Verde, Cayman Islands, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Costa Rica, Côte d'Ivoire, Curaçao, Ecuador, Egypt, El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea, Fiji, Gabon, Guinea Bissau, Guyana, Haiti, India, Indonesia, Iran, Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Kenya, Kiribati, Kuwait, Laos, Madagascar, Malaysia, Marshall Islands, Mongolia, Myanmar, Namibia, Nepal, Nicaragua, Nigeria, Oman, Palau, Papua New Guinea, Peru, Philippines, Qatar, Rwanda, Samoa, Saudi Arabia, Singapore, Solomon Islands, Somalia, Sri Lanka, Sudan, Suriname, Tanzania, Thailand, Timor-Leste, Tokelau, Tonga, Turkey, Tuvalu, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, Vanuatu, Venezuela, and Vietnam. Countries requiring passports valid for at least 4 months on arrival include Micronesia and Zambia. Countries requiring passports with a validity of at least 3 months beyond the date of intended departure include Azerbaijan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Honduras, Montenegro, Nauru, Moldova and New Zealand. Similarly, the [EEA](/wiki/European_Economic_Area) countries of Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, all [European Union](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_the_Schengen_Area) countries (except Ireland) together with Switzerland also require 3 months validity beyond the date of the bearer's intended departure unless the bearer is an EEA or Swiss national. Countries requiring passports valid for at least 3 months on arrival include Albania, North Macedonia, Panama, and Senegal. Bermuda requires passports to be valid for at least 45 days upon entry. Countries that require a passport validity of at least one month beyond the date of intended departure include Eritrea, Hong Kong, Lebanon, Macau, the Maldives and South Africa. #### Maximum passport age Countries of the [Schengen area](/wiki/Schengen_area) require non-EU passports to be less than 10 years old upon entry. ### Criminal record Some countries, including Australia, Canada, Fiji, New Zealand and the United States, routinely deny entry to non-citizens who have a [criminal record](/wiki/Criminal_record), while others impose restrictions [depending on the type of conviction](/wiki/List_of_countries_that_regulate_the_immigration_of_felons) and the length of the sentence. ### *Persona non grata* The government of a country can declare a diplomat *[persona non grata](/wiki/Persona_non_grata)*, banning them from entering the country or expelling them if they have already entered. In non-diplomatic use, the authorities of a country may also declare a foreigner *persona non grata* permanently or temporarily, usually because of unlawful activity. ### Israeli stamps Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, and Yemen do not allow entry to people with [passport stamps](/wiki/Passport_stamp) from Israel or whose passports have either a used or an unused Israeli visa, or where there is evidence of previous travel to Israel such as entry or exit stamps from neighbouring border posts in transit countries such as Jordan and Egypt. To circumvent this [Arab League boycott of Israel](/wiki/Arab_League_boycott_of_Israel#Passport_restrictions), the Israeli immigration services have now mostly ceased to stamp foreign nationals' passports on either entry to or exit from Israel (unless the entry is for some work-related purposes). Since 15 January 2013, Israel no longer stamps foreign passports at [Ben Gurion Airport](/wiki/Ben_Gurion_Airport). Passports are still (as of 22 June 2017[update]) stamped at [Erez](/wiki/Erez_Crossing) when passing into and out of [Gaza](/wiki/Gaza_Strip).[*citation needed*] Iran refuses admission to holders of passports containing an Israeli visa or stamp that is less than 12 months old. ### Biometrics Several countries mandate that all travellers, or all foreign travellers, be [fingerprinted](/wiki/Fingerprint) on arrival and will refuse admission to or even arrest travellers who refuse to comply. In some countries, such as the United States, this may apply even to transit passengers who merely wish to change planes rather than go [landside](/wiki/Airport#Landside_and_airside_areas). Fingerprinting countries/regions include Afghanistan, Argentina, Brunei, Cambodia, China, Ethiopia, Ghana, Guinea, India, Japan, Kenya (both fingerprints and a photo are taken), Malaysia upon entry and departure, Mongolia, Saudi Arabia, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan, Thailand, Uganda, the United Arab Emirates and the United States. Many countries also require a photo be taken of people entering the country. The United States, which does not fully implement [exit control](/wiki/Border_control#Exit_controls) formalities at its land frontiers (although long mandated by its own legislation), intends to implement [facial recognition](/wiki/Facial_recognition_system) for passengers departing from international airports to identify people who overstay their visa. Together with fingerprint and face recognition, [iris scanning](/wiki/Iris_recognition) is one of three biometric identification technologies internationally standardised since 2006 by the [International Civil Aviation Organization](/wiki/International_Civil_Aviation_Organization) (ICAO) for use in [e-passports](/wiki/E-passport) and the United Arab Emirates conducts iris scanning on visitors who need to apply for a visa. - Singapore portal - [Visa policy of Singapore](/wiki/Visa_policy_of_Singapore) - [Singapore passport](/wiki/Singapore_passport) ## Notes - Issuing of Singapore passports - Visa Information for Singapore passports; Provided by Singapore Ministry of Foreign Affairs
title: Visa requirements for Singapore citizens
